fields.title: Time of Starting
fields.description:
([Rule 6-3a](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-06,6-3)) 

_(modified in 2012)_

If a player arrives late for his starting time but within five (5) minutes of his starting time, ready to play, the penalty is loss of hole in match play or two strokes in stroke play.

fields.title: Water Hazards
fields.description:
([Rule 26-1](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-26,26-1))

All water hazards on the course are to be played as lateral water hazards. They are defined by either red stakes or red lines on holes N3, N4, N7, N8, N9, E5, E6, E9, W2, W3, W5, W7, W8. When both stakes and lines are present, the margin of the water hazard is defined by the **_LINES_**.

fields.title: Obstructions
fields.description:
([Rule 24](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-24))

All cart paths are obstructions, whether or not they are artificially surfaced.

The maintenance building and fenced off area around it (holes 6E, 8E, 9E) are treated as an immovable obstruction. Relief may be taken in accordance with rule [24-2](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-24,24-2).

All sprinkler control boxes are immovable obstructions. Relief may be taken in accordance with rule [24-2](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-24,24-2).

All colored yardage marker plates are immovable obstructions. Relief without penalty may be taken in accordance with rule [24-2](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-24,24-2).

fields.title: Stones in Bunkers
fields.description: Stones in bunkers are movable obstructions. Relief without penalty may be taken in accordance with rule [24-1](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-24,24-1).

fields.title: Ground Under Repair
fields.description:
([Rule 25](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-25))

Areas defined by white lines are deemed to be ground under repair and one club-length relief without penalty may be taken in accordance with [Rule 25-1b](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-25,25-1). French drains, which are exposed trenches filled with rocks or stones (not when they are covered over with soil or grass) are ground under repair.

White lined areas tying into artificially-surfaced roads or paths are declared to be obstructions, not ground under repair. Relief, without penalty, is provided under [Rule 24-2b(i)](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-24,24-2).

fields.title: Ball on Wrong Green
fields.description: If a ball comes to rest on a wrong green, a ball must be dropped in accordance with [Rule 25-3](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-25,25-3).

fields.title: Embedded Ball
fields.description: [Through the green](http://www.usga.org/videos/2013/03/05/usga-rules--through-the-green-2203356220001.html), a ball which is embedded in its own pitch-mark in ground other than loose sand may be lifted without penalty, cleaned and dropped as near as possible to the spot where it lay and must come to rest no nearer the hole.

fields.title: Aeration Holes
fields.description:
When aeration holes exist:

* [Through the green](http://www.usga.org/videos/2013/03/05/usga-rules--through-the-green-2203356220001.html), a ball that comes to rest in or on an aeration hole may be lifted without penalty, cleaned and dropped as near as possible to the spot where it lay but not nearer the hole. The ball dropped must first strike a part of the course through the green.

* On the putting green, a ball that comes to rest in or on an aeration hole may be placed at the nearest spot not nearer the hole that avoids the situation.

fields.title: USGA Approved Equipment / Non-conforming Equipment
fields.description:
USGA APPROVED EQUIPMENT/NON-CONFORMING EQUIPMENT

Only golf equipment/balls approved by the USGA may be used in Bunker Hills Men's Golf Club activities. Penalty for use of non-conforming equipment/balls is disqualification.

fields.title: Stroke Play: Doubt as to Procedure
fields.description:
([Rule 3-3](http://www.usga.org/rules/rules-and-decisions.html#!rule-03,3-3))

If in doubt as to the correct procedure, you may play a second ball. Before putting a second ball into play, announce to your marker/fellow competitor your intention to play a second ball, and which you wish to count if necessary. Then play out your original ball and at the same time complete the play of the hole with a second ball. The competitor shall report the facts to the Committee immediately after finishing the round.

fields.title: Match Play Disputes
fields.description: While playing a match, should a dispute arise that affects the outcome of a hole, you may continue playing the match with the hole(s) in question undecided. Once the match is complete, should the hole(s) in question affect the outcome of the match, you should consult the pro shop personnel for a ruling, or a member of the match play tournament committee.

fields.title: Discontinuance of Play
fields.description: In case of lightning, a player has the right to stop play if he thinks he is in danger even though the committee may not have specifically authorized it by signal. Official halt of play will be signaled by one prolonged horn note, repeated. Resumption of play shall be signaled by two short horn notes, repeated.

fields.title: GPS Equipped Carts and Laser Rangefinders
fields.description: During BHMGC events, players may use artificial devices that measure distance only. The use of artificial devices that gauge or measure other conditions that might affect a player's play (e.g. wind or gradient) regardless of whether or not that device also measures distance, are not permitted. Penalty for using a device that measures conditions other than distances is disqualification.

fields.title: Use of Personal Music Devices and Speakers
fields.description:
The Board of Directors of Bunker Hills Men's Golf Club has determined the use of music devices and Bluetooth speaker devices acceptable under the following conditions:

* Anytime during practice on the driving range or practice facility
* During a men's club round, your playing partners must agree
* Must turn down if requested
* Must turn off if requested
* Not to be used in majors
* Ear buds are not allowed during official playing competition.  Ear buds are allowed to be used during practice

While the Board approves the use of music devices and external speakers, it encourages members to be respectful in the use of these devices.

fields.title: Unclaimed Skins
fields.description:
**Definition:** Skins that have been won in a previous event but not yet claimed. 

Skins not claimed by the end of the last event of the year after the year the skin was won will be determined to be an unclaimed skin.Unclaimed skins will be deposited into the general fund of the Bunker Hills Men's Golf Club.

fields.title: Unclaimed Proshop Credit
fields.description:
**Definition:** Pro Shop credit awarded to a member but not yet redeemed for merchandise.

Pro Shop credit not redeemed by the end of the year after the year it was awarded will be considered unclaimed Pro Shop credit. Unclaimed Pro Shop credit will be removed from the member's Pro shop credit balance and will no longer be available to be redeemed for merchandise. Unclaimed Pro Shop Credit will be deposited into the general fund of the Bunker Hills Men's Golf Club.

fields.title: Wednesday Night Sign-up / Check-in
fields.description:
There are two options for Wednesday night 9 hole events

* Sign up online at [www.bunkerhillsgolf.com](http://www.bunkerhillsgolf.com)
* You can sign up in person at the course approximately 45 minutes prior to the event's tee time. Beginning this 2014 season BHMGC will make available online green fees as an option to be paid when signing up online. Please ensure you retain your PayPal receipt when paying for green fees online. 

Green fees must be paid at the Pro Shop prior to play if paying at the course.  Failure to pay for green fees prior to an event can result in disiplinary action up to and including expulsion from the club after board review.

fields.title: Weekend Major Event Registration
fields.description: Weekend and major events require the submission of advance entry. To register in advance, you may turn in your entry to the pro shop or sign up via the web site. Entries received prior to the posted deadline date are guaranteed acceptance (provided all other requirements are met). Any entries received after the posted deadline will be placed on alternate status. Any openings in the event will be filled by the alternates in the order received (or if necessary by random draw) until the field is full or no other alternate entries exist. Green fees must be paid the day of the event, regardless of which method is used to register.

fields.title: Event Scorecards
fields.description:
For Wednesday events  To be eligible for prizes in Wednesday competitions, you must turn in completed scorecards (tabulated and signed by at least 2 participants) to the Pro Shop immediately following your round. The card must contain each player's name, local number and hole-by-hole gross scores. All score cards must be signed and attested. All scores MUST be turned in on official BHMGC scorecards. Standard Bunker Hills Golf Course scorecards will NOT be accepted.

For weekend and major events  Pre-printed scorecards will be issued on the first tee. Hole by hole gross scores must be recorded for only the player(s)listed on the scorecard. All scorecards must be signed and attested (2 signatures required). Scorecards not following the above guidelines will be subject to disqualification.

fields.title: Tie Breakers
fields.description: Unless stipulated otherwise on the event sheet, ties will be broken by the TPP card match system. A hole by hole score comparison will be made starting with the lowest handicapped hole (hardest hole), and will continue in order of the handicap allocation until a winner is decided. If no winner is decided by this method, the players will remain tied and will split the appropriate prize money.

fields.title: Event Results and Disputes
fields.description: Preliminary results will be posted as soon as practical after the event. Unless a dispute is properly submitted beforehand, results will become official one week after the preliminary results have been posted. Winnings will be posted in the pro-shop books within one week after the official results are posted. Disputes will be considered only if submitted within one week of posting the preliminary results. A dispute must be submitted in writing or e-mail and include the following information: * Name of player * Event name and date * Posted result * Description of the dispute (please be as detailed) * Date dispute submitted * Phone number, or best way to contact you if more information is needed Written disputes must either be mailed to the BHMGC address, emailed to the event chairmen, or can be submitted via the BHMGC web site [Contact Us]() page. The event committee will respond to all disputes within 2 weeks from the date submitted. All decisions are final.

fields.title: Entry Cancellation / Refund
fields.description:
* No refunds will be made for cancellations within 24 hours of the start of the event. No refunds will be made in cases where the member does not show up for the event.
* If you have submitted an advance entry form/payment and need to cancel, you may be eligible for a refund. You must call the Tournament Chairman more than 24 hours in advance to cancel your entry and be eligible for a refund.
* If you paid online your refund will be processed through PayPal and refunded to the account you originally paid. 
* If you mailed in or dropped off payment at the pro shop a refund will be mailed to you via US mail. Please allow up to 2 weeks for refund checks.

fields.title: Hole in One / Double Eagle Prize Pool
fields.description:
$2 from each member's yearly dues is dedicated to a Hole-in-One/Double Eagle Prize Pool. Members who score a Hole-in-One or Double Eagle at Bunker Hills must follow the procedures specified below to be eligible for a share of the prize pool.

* Eligibility begins with the start of the official USGA golf season in Minnesota (Apr 1st) and concludes with the end of the USGA golf season in Minnesota (Oct 31st).
* The Hole-In-One/Double Eagle must be accomplished at Bunker Hills Golf Course. The shot(s) must be played during a stipulated round (practice holes played either before or after a stipulated round are excluded) under the USGA Rules of Golf (i.e., conforming golf ball, club, etc.). In order for a double-eagle scored on a par 5 to qualify for this prize, both shots must be played by the same player in accordance with the Rules of Golf.
* The shot(s) must be:
	* Witnessed during a one-ball round of golf (9 holes minimum)
	* Witnessed during any event sanctioned, sponsored, or conducted by the Bunker Hills Men's Club, the United States Golf Association (USGA), Minnesota Golf Association (MGA), Minnesota Public Golf Association (MPGA), Professional Golf Association (PGA) Tour, or Minnesota Section of the Professional Golf Association (PGA) of America.
	* Made with equipment conforming to USGA regulations.

To be eligible to receive all or any portion of the Hole-In-One/Double Eagle Pool, a member must provide written notification to the BHMGC Board of Directors no later than one week after the conclusion of the USGA Minnesota golf season in which the Hole-In-One/Double Eagle was achieved. The notification must include the following information:

* Member's name
* Date
* Hole number and course
* Distance
* Club(s) used
* Ball used
* Name of witness(es)

The fund will be shared equally should more than one member score a Hole-In-One/Double Eagle. Multiple Holes-In-One/Double Eagles by a single member shall count as separate shares for pool distribution.

In the event no Holes-In-One/Double Eagles are scored, one-half of the pool shall be donated to the Bunker Hills Scholarship Fund and one-half carried over to the following year's pool.

fields.title: Slow Play
fields.description:
Slow play is tolerated at Bunker Hills, but we will occasionally pay lip service to doing something about it. The entirely theoretical and unenforced slow play policy for all events is:

* If your group is not in position with the group ahead of you and you are not maintaining a pace of 15 minutes per hole, or you are in the first group and not maintaining a pace or 15 minutes per hole, your group will be warned.
* Your group has 2 holes to make position progress. Failure to make position progress could subject each competitor to a 1 stroke penalty.
* If your group has not made any position progress 3 holes after being warned, each competitor may be subject to an additional 2 stroke penalty.
* Further slow play may result in disqualification of any or all competitors in the group.

fields.title: Proxy Competitions
fields.description:
Proxy competitions are typically held for all BHMGC sponsored events. All players entering an event are eligible for any Proxy competition being held. Proxy markers will be left on the applicable greens prior to the beginning of any event where proxy competitions are held. If no markers are present, proxies will not be awarded for that hole. Proxy prizes are awarded to the player whose first tee shot is: a) on the putting surface and b) closer to the hole (measured from the center of the ball to the nearest edge of the hole) than all other players who play that hole in the competition.

To determine if a shot is nearer the hole than the current proxy, players should use the method, which is most practical under the circumstances and avoid unduly delaying play. Players may enlist the assistance of the others in their groups if necessary.

To be eligible for proxy prizes the player must:

* Write his name and local number under the "Proxy" section of the card provided.
* Place the proxy marker on the spot where the ball came to rest, or a spot equidistant from the hole to the spot where the ball came to rest.
* The person that ends up with the closest shot to the hole will be awarded the proximity prize.

fields.title: Handicaps
fields.description: The USGA Handicap System is based on the assumption that every player will endeavor to make the best score he can on each hole in every round he plays and that he will report every acceptable round for handicap purposes, regardless of where the round is played.

fields.title: New Member Handicaps
fields.description: New members are advised that a minimum of five (5) 18-hole or combined eligible scores must be posted before a handicap can be calculated. These scores can be achieved at any golf course during the golf season. New members are encouraged to accomplish this as soon as possible, so they can compete in scheduled events that require an established handicap. New members are required to have an established handicap not later than May 15. Failure to accomplish this will result in the member being required to play all events at scratch until a handicap is established.

fields.title: Acceptable Scores
fields.description:
9-hole and 18-hole scores shot between April 1 and October 31, both at home and away, played under the rules of golf in either stroke or match play, including those made in multi-ball competition, must be reported in chronological order. Scores shot in Minnesota on dates other than the official season are not to be reported. Scores shot by a player outside Minnesota during Minnesota's Inactive season (November 1  March 31) in an area where scores are acceptable shall return those scores, posting them in chronological order. Scores must be adjusted according to the following Equitable Stroke Control (ESC) table.

    | 18-Hole Course Handicap | Maximum Score Posted On Any Hole |
    | ----------------------- | -------------------------------- |
    | 9 or less               | 2 over par                       |
    | 10 through 19           | 7                                |
    | 20 through 29           | 8                                |
    | 30 through 39           | 9                                |
    | 40 through 49           | 10                               |
    | 50 and above            | 11                               |

If you play thirteen holes or more, you shall record a score for handicap purposes by adding to the number of strokes played, the total of par for the holes not played, plus any handicap strokes to which you are entitled on the holes not played.

**Conceded strokes or incomplete holes:** If you start but do not complete a hole or a stroke is conceded, you shall record for handicap purposes the score you most likely would have made if you had completed the hole.

fields.title: Applying Handicaps
fields.description:
All events will be played with USGA handicaps unless otherwise specified.

In match play, all matches are to be played from the tees selected by the player unless otherwise agreed upon. The player with the lowest handicap will play at zero and other players will receive strokes based on the difference between their respective handicaps.

If handicap difference is an odd number, the odd stroke will be awarded on the more difficult nine. Difficulty ranking;(1) WEST, (2) NORTH,(3) EAST.

fields.title: Handicap Computer Terminal
fields.description: When entering scores on the computer terminal, **_READ_** and follow the instructions on the screen. If you have problems operating the computer, ask for assistance from the pro shop or a board member. If the computer is not working properly, notify the Pro Shop personnel. Members are required to enter all eligible scores as soon as practical after completing their round. Posting of scores via the internet is available via a link off the [club website](http://www.bunkerhillsgolf.com) or directly via [GHIN](http://www.ghin.com).

fields.title: Determining Handicap for Events
fields.description: Unless noted otherwise in the official BHMGC event sheet, all course handicaps will be computed by GHIN TPP for handicapped events.

fields.title: Score Posting for Events
fields.description:
The Pro Shop and designated board members will post eligible scores from BHMGC Wednesday afternoon, night, weekend, and major events. Scores achieved during all other round played are the responsibility of the player to post to GHIN.

Each player must endeavor to post his scores during the applicable 2-week posting period.

All scores should be posted as soon as possible following play. If playing away from Bunker Hills, a guest score may be posted at the course if it is using the GHIN system. Members may also post scores via the Internet. A link is available on the BHMGC web site. The Handicap Committee monitors score posting. Failure to post acceptable scores could result in the assessment of a penalty score or handicap adjustment

Members must play in a Minimum of 3 sanctioned events to qualify for club championship(s).

Members must play in a minimum of 3 sanctioned Men's Club events to qualify to play in the Sr. Club Championship or Club Championship. Sanctioned events are those that earn season long points, 24 man team events and 8 man team events. Exemption will be granted to the previous years Sr. Club and Club Champions. The Board of Directors can exempt a member from the rule for valid reasons. The definition of a valid reason(s) will be determined by the Board of Directors
